Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 5, 30
Description.abstract: (10) Pp. 252-254.  Three-page treatise on the liar paradox. This problem of logic has been discussed since the 4th century B.C.E. Theophrastus is thought to have written on this topic, but his work is lost.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1983), p. 657.

Description.abstract: Pp. 122-449.  A commentary written for the Timurid Shah Ulugh Beg by Qāḍī Zādah (d. ca. A.D. 1436) on al-Chaghmīnī's (d. A.D. 1344) treatise on astronomy al-Mulakhkhaṣ fī ʿilm al-hayʾah.

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts
Subject: Islam $x Doctrines $v Early works to 1800|~|Shīʿah $x Doctrines $v Early works to 1800
Title: Sharḥ ʿalā ʿAllāmah al-Ḥillī fī al-kalām
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 5, 34
Description.abstract: Pp. 4-44.  A work on kalām, missing the beginning. Begins with section two, which is a commentary on ʿAllāmah Ḥillī's positions on kalām. It is followed by section three, where the author discusses other matters regarding kalām, including aspects of Shīʿī doctrines. The text is the product of a muqabalah with a manuscript of the commentator dated A.H. 723. Author is unknown.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1983), p. 659.

Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 5, 34
Description.abstract: Pp. 46-63.  Fragment, missing beginning and ending. A manual on literary eloquence, including discussions on speech and grammar and a commentary on the famous grammarian al-Sībawayh. Author is unknown.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1983), p. 659.

Description.abstract: Pp. 65-75.  This is a treeatise on the incorrect usage of Arabic expressions, using examples from stories about the early Shīʿī imams and leaders, including al-Ḥasan, al-Ṣādiq and Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥanafiyah. Missing end folios.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1983), p. 659.

Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1983), p. 659.

Title: al-Ḥāshīyah al-sharīfīyah ʿalá sharḥ al-muṭawwal li-talkhīṣ al-Miftāḥ
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 53, 367
Description.abstract: A commentary by al-Sayyid al-Sharīf al-Jurjānī (d. A.H. 816) on Taftazānī's (d. A.H. 792) al-Sharḥ al-muṭawwal li-Talkhīṣ al-Miftāḥ. al-Sharḥ al-muṭawwal is one of two commentaries by Taftazānī, the other being al-Sharḥ al-mukhtaṣar, on Jalal al-Dīn Muḥammad al-Qazwīnī’s (d. A.H. 739) Talkhīṣ al-Miftāḥ, an abridgment of the third section of Sirāj al-Din Yūsuf al-Kākī’s (d. A.H. 626) Miftāḥ al-ulūm on Arabic grammar and morphology, more specifically on bayān and maʿná. Missing end folios and includes notes in the margins.
Alternate Title.scriptArab: الحاشية الشريفية على شرح المطول تلخيص المفتاح

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts
Subject: Taftāzānī, Masʿūd ibn ʿUmar, $d 1322-1389? $t Muṭawwal|~|Arabic language $x Grammar $v Early works to 1800|~|Arabic language $x Rhetoric $v Early works to 1800|~|Qazwīnī, Jalāl al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān, $d 1267 or 8-1338. $t Talkhīṣ al-Miftāḥ
Name.author: Jurjānī, ʿAlī ibn Muḥammad, $c al-Sayyid al-Sharīf, $d 1340-1413
Title: al-Ḥāshiyah al-sharīfiyah ʿalá sharḥ al-Muṭawwal li-talkhiṣ al-Miftāḥ
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 76, 550
Description.abstract: A commentary by al-Sayyid al-Sharīf al-Jurjānī (d. A.H. 816) on Taftazānī's (d. A.H. 792) al-Sharḥ al-muṭawwal li-Talkhīs al-Miftāḥ. Al-Sharḥ al-muṭawwal is one of two commentaries by Taftazānī, the other being al-Sharḥ al-muqtaṣar, on Jalal al-Dīn Muḥammad al-Qazwīnī’s (d. A.H. 739) Talkhīṣ al-Miftāḥ, an abridgment of the third section of Sirāj al-Din Yūsuf al-Kākī’s (d. A.H. 626) Miftāḥ al-ulūm on bayān and maʿná. On Arabic grammar and rhetoric. Beginning folios and large of parts of the text are missing. Includes notes in the margins .
Alternate Title.scriptArab: الحاشية الشريفية على شرح المطول لتلخيص المفتاح

Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 6, 37
Description.abstract: Pp. 16-255.  A commentary on Ṭusī's Tajrīd al-Iʿtiqād, on philosophical issues concerning the subject of metaphysics (especially atoms and accidents). Missing beginning folios and includes notes in the margins.  DP uncertain about authorship.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1983), p. 661.

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts

Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, box 6, 37
Description.abstract: Pp. 257-274.  Treatise on the movement of the stars. Missing beginning and end folios, includes notes in the margins and nine astronomical figures. Author is unknown.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1983), p. 661.
Description.note: Dānishpazhūh dates manuscript as 9th C. AH.  Note discrepancy between the date of this work and that of the previous work.

It is also a commentary on a chapter in Sayūrī's al-Lawāmiʿ al-Ilāhiyah.

Subject: Signs and symbols $z Middle East |~|Islamic art and symbolism|~|Middle East $x Geography
Title: Khātamah dar bayān-i badāyiʿ va ṣanāyiʿ
Source: Caro Minasian Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts, 1449
Description.abstract: Pages 1-12 of this work includes detailed descriptions of various Islamic mystico-religious symbols, such as "qalam," "kursī" and "ʿarsh." The rest of the work, beginning on page 12 under the rubric گفتار در عجايب  و غرايب,  is a treatise on the various ancient regions and cities of the Middle and Near East such as al-Shām, Dimashq, Bukhārā, ʿIrāq, Shīrāz, Khurāsān etc. It contains both geographic and historical details of each.
Alternate Title.scriptArab: خاتمه در بيان بدايع و صنايع

Subject: Geography $v Early works to 1800|~|Geometry $v Early works to 1800|~|Astronomy $v Early works to 1800
Name.author: Qūshjī, ʿAlī ibn Muḥammad, $d d. 1474 or 5
Title: Mīzān al-ḥisāb
Description.abstract: This treatise is divided into different sections. It opens with a brief survey of general geometry and the second part includes two treatises. One explains the planets in the solar system and the other touches upon the planet Earth's geography, its regions and the equator.

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts
Subject: Shīʿah $x Doctrines $v Early works to 1800
Name.creator: ʿĀmilī, Bahāʾ al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Ḥusayn $d 1547-1621
Title: Risālah fī al-iʿtiqādāt
Description.abstract: Polemical epitome of standard Twelver Shi'ite articles of faith, each introduced by "we believe..."  whence DP derives the title Iʿtiqādāt.  DP (728) attributes to Shaykh-i Bahā', but I cannot see why.

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts
Subject: Occupations $x Philosophy $v Early works to 1800
Title: Risālah-'i ṣināʿiyyah
Description.abstract: This is a philosophical treatise on occupations, arranging them according to a Platonic hierarchy.  Author: Abu al-Qāsim b. Mīrzā Ḥusaynī Astarābādī, aka Mīr Findiriskī (d. 1640/1).  Pp. 16-78 in Majmūʿah.

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts
Subject: Angels $x Islam
Title: Risālah dar arwāḥ-i falakī
Description.abstract: Brief treatise on the celestial spirits.  Pp. 80-86.  Authorship unknown.

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts
Subject: Health
Title: Risālah-'i ṭibbī
Description.abstract: A treatise in five parts concerning health (not really medicine, as DP's title suggests).  Sections on the preservation of one's eyes and teeth; demeanor; natural and non-natural aging; the recognition of poisonous tastes.  َAuthor unknown.  Pp. 88-93.

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts
Subject: Sermons, Arabic
Title: Khuṭab
Description.abstract: Pp. 96-116.  =DP no. 6, Khuṭbah'hā-yi ʿarabī.  Sermons.

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts
Subject: Perception $v Early works to 1800|~|Thought and thinking $v Early works to 1800

Title: Mirʾāt al-muḥaqqiqīn
Description.abstract: Pp. 118-143.  DP: No. 7 (p. 729) [NB DP has typo in title, m-ḥ-q-ī-q-n for muḥaqqiqīn.]  Treatise on the soul.  Peripatetic in tone, covering faculties, perception, knowledge.

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts
Subject: Hadith $v Early works to 1800

Description.abstract: Commentary by [H]usayn b. Ismāʿīl [H]usaynī on the Hadīth-i kamīl.  Occasional marginal notation.  Pp. 1-325.
Alternate Title.scriptArab: رساله در شرح حدیث کمیل|~|Risālah dar sharḥ-i Ḥadīth-i kamīl

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts
Subject: Handbooks, vade-mecums, etc.|~|Islamic almanacs
Title: Zubur va bayyināt nāmhā-yi maʿṣūmān
Description.note: DP has this as one work plus "scatterings."  [A better title for this "work" would be "assorted notes, several authors."]326: Zubur va bayyināt.  DP takes the title of this section from this, "psalms [or prophecies] and proofs."  (See Qur'an 3.184)  DP attributes to "Master (T)ūṣī." (DP 729)  Headnote in text concerning imams gives him the "names of the immaculate ones."  Text of Qur'an 33.33 with marginal notations.327: a verse from Mīr Dāmād, and a list of 'Abbasid caliphs.328-362: Transcription of the remembrances of Qā(D)ī Mullah ʿAzīz (S)āfī.  This is in same hand, different inks, with dates here and there, 1301-1302; many marginal notes.363-396: Scatterings (dated 1305, 1306) with extensive marginalia; culminating in sustained narrative from 375 on; dated 1308.  The latter part is about minerals.  From 374, the name Mullā Sulaymān begins to appear in signatures.Three blank pages at end of text which are not numbered; next part of majmūʿah begins on page 397.

Subject: Rāzī, Fakhr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn ʿUmar, $d 1149 or 50-1210. $t Arbaʿīn fī uṣūl al-dīn|~|Islam $x Doctrines $v Early works to 1800

Title: Fī maʿād al-arbaʿīn
Description.abstract: This seems to be an epitome of Fakhr al-Dīn al-Rāzī's summa theologiae K. al-Arbaʿīn fī uṣūl al-dīn.  Pp. 204-214.  DP gives the title and suggests Rāzī.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1983), p. 707.

Title: Maqāmāt al-ʿārifīn nāẓir ilā al-Ishārāt
Description.abstract: Notes on Avicenna's al-Ishārāt.

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts
Name.creator: ʿAllāmah al-Ḥillī, Jamāl al-Dīn Abī Manṣūr al-Ḥasan ibn Sadīd al-Dīn (A.H. 648-726)
Title: Al-bāb al-ḥādī ʿashar
Description.abstract: Pre-eminent exposition of Shi'ite creed.  Pp. 4-16.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1983), p. 707.

Subject: Islam $x Rituals $v Early works to 1800
Title: Al-Risālah al-Najmīyah
Description.abstract: Treatise on theological principles and prayer (i.e., not an astronomical treatise, despite name).  Pp. 20-34.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1983), p. 707.

Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1983), p. 707.

Description.abstract: Glosses on Suyūṭī's treatise on grammar (unknown author).
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1983), p. 708.

Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1983), p. 709.

Subject: Koran. $p Sūrat al-Fātiḥah $v Commentaries $v Early works to 1800

Description.abstract: Tafsīr on the opening Sūrah of the Qur'an; on the first page the author identifies himself as ʿAlī b. Abī Saʿīd al-Jīlānī (Dānishpazhūh write Gīlānī).   Pp. 4-146.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1983), p. 709.

Title: Mirʾāt al-azmān
Description.abstract: Philosophical treatise on time.  See Dharīʿah 3.352.  Marginal commentary.  Apparently incomplete.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1983), p. 709.

Title: Sharḥ khulāṣat al-faṣl al-awwal min al-Istibṣār
Description.abstract: Commentary on the first part of al-Tusi's Istibsar, one of the four canonical collections of Shi'ah tradition.  First 12 pp. of volume.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1983), p. 709.  Misidentified as ms 1079.

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts
Subject: Islam $x Doctrines $v Early works to 1800
Name.author: Bihbahānī Kirmānshāhī, Muḥammad ʿAlī ibn Muḥammad Bāqir, $d 1732-1801 or 2
Title: Fawāʾid
Description.abstract: Two sections: Al-Fawāʾid al-ʿatīqah and al-Fawāʾid al-jadīdah, i.e. old and new lessons.  Thirty-six lessons on religious matters in the old section, beginning on page 13.  The new section is a brief six-page addition of 3 lessons, which Dānish-pazhūh identifies as a separate work.  Due to an error in the manuscript itself, Dānish-pazhūh lists the first section as containing only twenty-six lessons.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1983), p. 710.

Title: Taʿlīqāt ʿalā Masāʾil al-tajzīyah fī al-ijtihād
Description.abstract: A commentary on independent legal thought (al-ijithād).
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1983), p. 710.

Description.abstract: Fāʾidah literature (i.e. a collection of useful lessons on Islamic acts of devotion), similar to work 1074_002.
Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1983), p. 710.

Project Name: Minasian (Caro) Collection of Persian and Arabic Manuscripts

Description.citation: Muḥammad Taqī Dānish-pazhūh, Fihrist-i Nushahhā-yi khaṭṭī, daftar 11 & 12 (Ṭihrān: Intishārāt-i Dānishgāh-i Ṭihrān, 1983), p. 709.

Title: Rawḍat al-muttaqīn fī sharḥ Man lā yaḥḍuruhu al-faqīh
Description.abstract: (1) This is apparently selections from a single volume of Majlisī’s massive commentary on the Shiʿite canonical legal text; Majlisī’s son, Muḥammad Bāqir, incorporated many of his father’s work into his own Biḥar al-anwār, however—this may be one of those duplicated parts.  Both authors produced their original versions of the above texts in Arabic, but translated selections for their royal patrons: thus this is received in the Persian redaction. 13th C. AH (DP)
Alternate Title.scriptArab: روضة المتقين في شرح من لا يضحره الفقيه
